intro: Erodium obliquifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. The species is part of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
